intro: Pilosella onegensis, commonly known as the Onega hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has a low-growing habit with hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Pilosella onegensis is often found in areas with sandy or gravelly soils and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
